intro: Chiococca spicata, commonly known as the pink-flowered chiococca, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its distinctive pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Chiococca spicata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
